data.title: The 10 Best Online Music Production Courses of 2023
data.meta_description: Find the best music production online courses. Read our course reviews to learn about pricing, curriculum, and whether or not you’re the right fit for each class.
data.text:
Our Ranking Criteria

The top online music production courses provide you with a balance of inspiration, clear instructions on how to make the best use of music production software, and the skills needed to develop, create, and refine your music. We researched 30 online music production courses before narrowing down to the top 10 in this guide. When deciding which programs to include and which to leave out, we used the following criteria.

Basic Ranking Criteria

Before committing to an online course, you should have a sense of the time required to complete the course, whether any prerequisites are required, how flexible the schedule is, and what sort of certificate you can expect to earn upon completion. That’s why for each online music production course covered in this guide, we looked at four basic factors.

Time to complete. You should be able to complete your online music production course relatively quickly to create tangible products (songs). The courses in this guide take anywhere from a few hours to five months to complete. They are all self-paced, so the time to complete is ultimately up to you.

Prerequisites required. None of the courses covered in this guide require any prerequisites. If you have no background in music creation or production, you can dive straight into any of the courses and start learning.

Flexible schedule. Most people are strapped for time so we selected self-paced, part-time courses with flexible schedules to best suit your needs.

Certificate of completion. Some of the courses in this guide offer a certificate of completion, which is a valuable addition to your resume.

Advanced Ranking Criteria

The basic criteria mentioned above are relevant to nearly all online courses. Listed below are some of the key factors specific to music production.

The course covers a variety of music production skills, from composition and songwriting to recording and sound engineering to mixing and mastering.

The instructors are skilled teachers with first-hand experience as successful music producers.

The course’s effectiveness has been proven by graduates successfully producing music or advancing in their music-related careers.

The course utilizes hands-on, project-based exercises that help students learn by doing.

The course provides students with clear, step-by-step instructions for using industry-standard music production software.

The course acquaints students with important techniques, vocabulary, and norms within the world of music production.

The course walks students through the entire process of creating a song so by the end, they have at least one polished piece of music.

10 Best Online Music Production Courses

Coursera

Music Production Specialization

Intelligent Award: Top Pick

Coursera’s Music Production Specialization is offered by Berklee College of Music. It’s a bundle of four courses on the following topics: the art of music production, the technology of music production, Pro Tools basics, and a music production capstone project. Whether you take one course or all four, you’re automatically enrolled in the Music Production Specialization bundle and can return to the courses at a later date. This is a good investment if you don’t have time to complete the full sequence now. Of all the courses included in this guide, this Specialization takes the longest at a total of five months. The material is self-paced so you can complete the course faster or slower depending on your needs. Coursera provides financial aid opportunities to students who cannot afford the course fee.

Price: First month free; subsequent months $39 per month

Time to complete: Approximately 5 months (3 hours per week)

Prerequisites required: No

Flexible schedule: Yes

Includes verified certificate of participation: Yes

Who should take this course? The comprehensiveness of this course and the flexible scheduling, top-notch instructors, and reasonable price-point, make this a great option for anyone interested in learning what it takes to produce music.

What we like What we don’t like Flexible scheduling and pricing. More of a time commitment. Top-notch instructors. Hands-on capstone project.

Learn More

Skillshare

Blueprint to Beatmaking

Intelligent Award: Most Affordable

Skillshare’s Blueprint to Beatmaking course offers a seven-day free trial and an $8 per month course fee. The course is about three hours long so could be completed within the free seven days.We included another Skillshare course in this guide but it’s a third of the length of Blueprint to Beatmaking so you don’t get as much content for your investment. Blueprint to Beatmaking is very user-friendly and provides a step-by-step system for producing hip-hop music. Lessons are short, actionable, and engaging. The clear and simple system saves you time, effort, and allows you to diveinto making music. The course includes a hands-on class project.

Price: 7-day free access period; $8 per month after free trial

Time to complete: 3 hours, 5 minutes

Prerequisites required: No

Flexible schedule: Yes

Includes verified certificate of participation: No

Who should take this course? Anyone seeking an introductory course geared toward hip-hop and beats should consider this course. The time commitment and money are minimal, so it’s perfect for exploring music production.

What we like What we don’t like Possible to complete the entire course for free. A condensed course that due to time constraints does not go very deep. Short, actionable course with a clear step-by-step system. Taught by an industry professional.

Learn More

Skillshare

Ableton Live I: The First Steps of Digital Music Production

Intelligent Award: Best for Beginners

Skillshare’s Ableton Live I course, the first course in a four-part series, shares much in common with Noiselab’s Electronic Music Production Level 1 course. The short length of Skillshare’s course makes it well suited to beginners as it is just over an hour.. By the end of the course, students can navigate Ableton Live and use it to warp three audio clips so they play at the same speed.

Price: Free 7-day trial; $8 per month after the free access period

Time to complete: 1 hour, 10 minutes

Prerequisites required: No

Flexible schedule: Yes

Includes verified certificate of participation: No

Who should take this course? This introductory course is great for beginners who are thinking about using Ableton Live and want a quick rundown of the navigation and key features. The time commitment is low, and it’s possible to take the course for free during the trial period.

What we like What we don’t like Very beginner-friendly. Limited scope. Low time commitment. Taught by a DAW expert.

Learn More

MasterClass

Timbaland Teaches Producing and Beatmaking

Intelligent Award: Best for Hip-Hop

This Masterclass course allows you to learn the ins and outs of producing and beatmaking from a master of the craft, Timbaland. The course walks you through Timbaland’s process for building a beat and shows you how a successful music producer works from the ground up. In addition to learning the process behind some of the biggest hip-hop hits of the past two decades, students get exercises to try out their music and emulate Timbaland’s process. Timbaland’s masterclass is less technical and more personality-driven as it’s about seeing a music production master at work. The course does not walk you through the step-by-step process of using music production software but gives rare insights into the artistic and technical process of music production.

Price: $18.60 per month (billed annually)

Time to complete: 3 hours, 2 minutes

Prerequisites required: No

Flexible schedule: Yes

Includes verified certificate of participation: No

Who should take this course? This course is great for people looking for music production inspiration. The entire course can be completed in a few hours, making it a good choice for those short on time who want to peek behind the curtain of music production.

What we like What we don’t like Flexible scheduling. Less technical and actionable than other courses. Great user experience. Provides inspiration and a behind-the-scenes look at the industry.

Learn More

MasterClass

deadmau5 Teaches Electronic Music Production

Intelligent Award: Best for Electronic Music/EDM

In addition to Timbaland’s course, Masterclass offers a course taught by electronic music phenomenon deadmau5. Like Timbaland’s course, deadmau5’s offers a window into his creative and technical process, showing you how he approaches melodies, mixing, and mastering to create unique, one-of-a-kind sounds. In addition to mini-lessons on topics like turning melodies into arrangements, experimenting with modular synths, and structuring songs, the course also tackles the industry side with mini-lessons on how to start a career in music production, tips for navigating the music business, and what it’s like to perform on stage.

Price: $18.60 per month (billed annually)

Time to complete: 5 hours, 25 minutes

Prerequisites required: No

Flexible schedule: Yes

Includes verified certificate of participation: No

Who should take this course? This introductory course is great for students interested in electronic music production. It’s more about inspiration than step-by-step techniques, so it’s best for students seeking to gain insights into the music production process and industry in a short time.

What we like What we don’t like Flexible scheduling. Less technical and actionable than other courses. Focuses on inspiration and industry insider tips. Taught by an electronic music master.

Learn More

LinkedIn Learning

Audio Mixing Masterclass

Intelligent Award: Best for Hands-On Exercises

LinkedIn Learning’s Audio Mixing Masterclass, taught by industry favorite Bobby Owsinski, is an intermediate course structured around hands-on exercises that get you to test out new tips, tricks, and strategies. Topics covered include instrument and vocal balance, panning, compression, EQ, reverb, delay, and making your mix as interesting as possible. Whereas most of the other courses included in this guide are geared towards beginners, this masterclass is best suited to students with some prior knowledge of and experience in music production. The mini-lessons are about five minutes or less and center on highly specific topics related to music production, such as “the pitchy vocal cover-up trick”, “the Tommy Lee thunder drums trick”, and “snappy snare.” Intermediate students can bounce around among the mini-lessons, choosing the topics they’re most interested in.

Price: $39.99

Time to complete: 9 hours, 14 minutes

Prerequisites required: No

Flexible schedule: Yes

Includes verified certificate of participation: Yes

Who should take this course? Anyone with a foundation in music production who’s looking to amp up their skills should take this course. The tips and tricks are nearly endless and actionable.

What we like What we don’t like Tons of mini-topics to choose from. Not suited to beginners. Top-rated instructor. Little to no overarching course structure. Some of the most sophisticated and specific tips available online.

Learn More

LinkedIn Learning

Music Production Secrets

Intelligent Award: Best for Insider Tips

LinkedIn Learning’s Music Production Secrets is a series of intermediate tutorials taught by Tape Op magazine founder and Jackpot! Recording Studio owner, Larry Crane. With over 20 years of experience, Larry Crane is a great source of industry tips and tricks on topics like “remove snare ring”, “double compressing vocals”, and “autopanning guitars and keyboards.” These mini-lessons in this course have a lot in common with the other LinkedIn Learning course featured in this guide, Audio Mixing Masterclass on LinkedIn Learning. This course covers a wider range of topics because it is not focused solely on audio mixing. Both courses provide 10 hours of instruction broken down into easy-to-digest five-minute mini-lessons.

Price: $34.99

Time to complete: 10 hours

Prerequisites required: No

Flexible schedule: Yes

Includes verified certificate of participation: Yes

Who should take this course? This course is great for intermediate and advanced music producers who want to learn some tips and tricks of the trade from an industry veteran. The mini-lessons are structured so students can easily pick and choose what they want to listen to and work on.

What we lke What we don’t like Very specific, hands-on tips and tricks. Not suitable for beginners. Taught by an industry veteran. Higher price point than some other courses. Tons of content to choose from.

Learn More

Noiselab

Electronic Music Production Level 1

Intelligent Award: Best for DAW Tutorial

Noiselab’s Electronic Music Production Level 1 course is a great way to familiarize yourself with one of the most popular and user-friendly digital audio workstations (DAW): Ableton Live. This is a crash course in Ableton Live that helps you understand what a DAW is, what makes Ableton Live unique, and how to get started using the software. Learning the functionality and possibilities of this software tool is key to creating great music. Other courses include a DAW tutorial as a component of the course material but this course centers on teaching you how to use the software step-by-step. It’s a great way to learn the technical ropes before diving into music production. This is the first course in a three-course series.

Price: Free for the first month for a first-time user; $14.25 per month after that

Time to complete: 4 hours, 15 minutes

Prerequisites required: No

Flexible schedule: Yes

Includes verified certificate of participation: No

Who should take this course? This course is perfect for anyone who wants to learn to use Ableton Live but doesn’t know where to start. Investing four hours of your time upfront to learn how to use the software is likely to pay off in the long run.

What we like What we don’t like Flexible scheduling. You can enroll in this course for free, but subsequent courses will cost you. Very beginner-friendly. Lots of practical tips.

Learn More

Udemy

Music + Audio Production in Logic Pro X – The Complete Guide

Intelligent Award: Best for Mac Users

Logic Pro X is a DAW owned by Apple, so the software runs exclusively on Mac OS. Udemy’s course Music + Audio Production in Logic Pro X teaches you the ins and outs of the software so you can navigate the tool like a pro and focus on making music, not troubleshooting the software. The course teaches you the quickest and easiest ways to write music in Logic Pro and aims to help you create professional-quality music. Even if you’ve never written a song before, the course teaches how to put together a song in under 120 seconds using Apple Loops and MIDI. The price point is relatively high, but there are two caveats, the site usually offers a 90% discount the first time you view the course page and you get a lot of content for your money: 40 hours of on-demand video, 15 articles, 2 downloadable resources, and full lifetime access to the course.

Price: $129.99, with the possibility of a 90% discount

Time to complete: 40 hours

Prerequisites required: No

Flexible schedule: Yes

Includes verified certificate of participation: Yes

Who should take this course? This course is perfect for students who are willing to invest the time and money needed to master the Logic Pro X software and take advantage of all of its capabilities.

What we like What we don’t like Very comprehensive. Relatively high price point. Great for beginners and established musicians alike. Time commitment may be too steep for some students. Action-oriented and efficient. Not suitable for Windows users.

Learn More

Udemy

FL Studio 20 – Music Production In FL Studio

Intelligent Award: Best for FL Studio

Like Ableton Live and Logic Pro X, FL Studio is another industry-standard DAW. Udemy’s course FL Studio 20 – Music Production In FL Studio is a deep dive into the usage of this powerful DAW. Whereas Logic Pro X can be used only on Apple, FL Studio is compatible with both Mac OS and Windows. The course aims to teach you how to use FL Studio in “just a day” but has over 14.5 hours of course material. The course is self-paced so you can move at the speed you prefer. This is a perfect course for beginners, as it starts with what to do before you even download FL Studio, and then walks you through every step to creating professional music productions.

Price: $179.99, with the possibility of a 90% discount

o complete: 14 hours, 44 minutes

Prerequisites required: No

Flexible schedule: Yes

Includes verified certificate of participation: Yes

Who should take this course? This course is perfect for students who are willing to invest the time and money needed to master the FL Studio software without the hassle of trial and error.

What we like What we don’t like Very comprehensive. Relatively high price point. Great for beginners and established musicians alike. Time commitment may be too steep for some students. Suitable for users of both Mac OS and Windows.

Tips for Succeeding in an Online Music Production Course

1. Consider the cost

How much do online music production classes cost?

Online music production course costs vary widely. You can expect to spend $0 for a free course or trial to several hundred dollars for a more intensive course. Keep in mind many of the courses included in this guide charge by the month for course access, so the sooner you complete the course, the cheaper it is.. Also, most fee-based courses offer the option of making payments in installments as opposed to upfront in one lump sum.

Will my employer pay for me to take the course?

Employers often reimburse or help to subsidize the cost of professional development courses and programs for their employees. If you work in an industry related to music, sound, production, or performance, there is a chance your employer will be willing to reimburse you for the cost of the course or at least pitch in to help. This is worth speaking to your boss or HR department about.

2. Get your tech squared away

Most of the online music production courses featured in this guide require some form of DAW software such as Pro Tools, Logic, Ableton Live, and/or FL Studio. These software tools typically offer a free trial period after which you need to pay for access to the software. It’s important to have access to the proper DAW for your course so you can make the most of hands-on assignments. Outside of the software, you can engage with all the course materials through your web browser. Your computer will need to be able to support streaming video, so you’ll want to make sure you have a fast, reliable wifi connection and at minimum, an i5-level processor and 8 GB of RAM. Keep in mind DAWs and large audio files use up a lot of space on your hard drive.

3. Use the right study resources

Many courses are geared towards beginners, so they offer great materials for laying a solid foundation in music production fundamentals. It’s beneficial to supplement course materials with outside resources. A few good places to start are MusicTech’s Beginner’s Guide to Music Production, Pensado’s Place episodes, and Mike Senior’s book Mixing Secrets for the Small Studio.
